articles.headline: Democrats Ask: Do We Really Want an All-White Final Four?
articles.snippet: As the party reckons with the likelihood of an all-white candidate lineup for the December debate, Cory Booker and Julián Castro see fund-raising gains.
articles.abstract: As the party reckons with the likelihood of an all-white candidate lineup for the December debate, Cory Booker and Julián Castro see fund-raising gains.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES — Senator Cory Booker strode onstage here with a question, one that voters, activists and disgruntled members of the Democratic National Committee are also asking in the wake of Senator Kamala Harris’s sudden departure from the 2020 race.
articles.byline: By Nick Corasaniti, Jennifer Medina and Lisa Lerer

articles.headline: Saudi Aramco to Raise $25.6 Billion in Biggest I.P.O. Ever
articles.snippet: Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, set a price for its shares that marks the company’s value at $1.7 trillion.
articles.abstract: Aramco, the world’s largest oil company, set a price for its shares that marks the company’s value at $1.7 trillion.
articles.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia’s giant state-owned oil company, Saudi Aramco, on Thursday set the price of its initial public offering at a level that would raise $25.6 billion, a sum that is expected to make it the world’s biggest I.P.O.
articles.byline: By Kate Kelly and Stanley Reed

articles.headline: General Strike in France Challenges Macron’s Latest Ambition for Change
articles.snippet: The president wants to combine a complex of 42 different generous pension schemes into one state system. It scares fellow citizens. And his personal style grates on many.
articles.abstract: The president wants to combine a complex of 42 different generous pension schemes into one state system. It scares fellow citizens. And his personal style grates on many.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The streets of French cities were filled with anti-government demonstrators, tear gas and police officers on Thursday as Emmanuel Macron again faced what has become an emblem of his presidency: social unrest. This time it was a general strike over his plans to overhaul the country’s pension system.

articles.headline: Uber Says 3,045 Sexual Assaults Were Reported in U.S. Rides Last Year
articles.snippet: In its first safety report, the ride-hailing company detailed sexual assaults, murders and fatal crashes through its platform.
articles.abstract: In its first safety report, the ride-hailing company detailed sexual assaults, murders and fatal crashes through its platform.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Uber said on Thursday that it had reports of 3,045 sexual assaults during its rides in the United States in 2018, with nine people murdered and 58 killed in crashes, in its first study detailing unsafe incidents on the ride-hailing platform.

articles.headline: U.S. Objects to World Bank’s Lending Plans for China
articles.snippet: The development institution has become the latest flash point between the world’s two largest economies.
articles.abstract: The development institution has become the latest flash point between the world’s two largest economies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration has formally objected to the World Bank’s plans to continue lending to China, the latest flash point in a long-running battle between the world’s largest economies.

articles.headline: When Pete Buttigieg Was One of McKinsey’s ‘Whiz Kids’
articles.snippet: The candidate, citing a nondisclosure agreement, has been largely mum about his stint at “the firm.” Former McKinsey employees helped fill in the blanks.
articles.abstract: The candidate, citing a nondisclosure agreement, has been largely mum about his stint at “the firm.” Former McKinsey employees helped fill in the blanks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Among the hoops that candidates for plum consulting jobs at McKinsey & Company had to jump through in late 2006 was a bit of play acting: They were given a scenario involving a hypothetical client, “a business under siege,” and told they would be meeting with its chief executive the next day. How would they structure the conversation?

articles.headline: Pelosi’s Leap on Impeachment: From No Go to No Choice
articles.snippet: Nine months ago, the speaker said President Trump was “just not worth it.” Then she saw an explosive headline.
articles.abstract: Nine months ago, the speaker said President Trump was “just not worth it.” Then she saw an explosive headline.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Speaker Nancy Pelosi was planning to deliver back-to-back eulogies at funerals here and in South Carolina during a busy weekend of late September travel when she saw an explosive headline in The Wall Street Journal: “Trump Repeatedly Pressed Ukraine to Investigate Biden’s Son.”

articles.headline: U.S. Added 266,000 Jobs in November. Here’s the Bottom Line.
articles.snippet: The Labor Department’s report was much stronger than the one last month, helped by the end of a General Motors strike.
articles.abstract: The Labor Department’s report was much stronger than the one last month, helped by the end of a General Motors strike.
articles.lead_paragraph: America’s job engine has again defied jittery stock traders, bearish forecasters and blue-ribbon economists to deliver eye-catching gains and power an exceptionally resilient economy.

articles.headline: Can a Coal Town Reinvent Itself?
articles.snippet: A coal town in southwestern Virginia has been trying for years. Hope is running thin.
articles.abstract: A coal town in southwestern Virginia has been trying for years. Hope is running thin.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRUNDY, Va. — Jay Rife surveys the landscape — hundreds of flat, grassy acres reclaimed from a spent mountaintop mine once operated by the Paramont Coal Company. A few handsome homes stand on one end of the project. An 80,000-square-foot shell, to house some future manufacturing operation, is being built on another. For the intrepid, there are trails for all-terrain vehicles. There’s an R.V. park. The whole site has been wired for broadband. Elk have been imported from Kentucky for tourists to look at.

articles.headline: Last Tax Season Was a Mess. Now’s Time to Prepare for This One.
articles.snippet: If you didn’t change the tax withholding in your paycheck, you still have time to avoid another unpleasant surprise — or even a fine.
articles.abstract: If you didn’t change the tax withholding in your paycheck, you still have time to avoid another unpleasant surprise — or even a fine.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first tax season under the Republican-sponsored overhaul brought an odd combination of pleasant and unpleasant surprises: lower tax burdens, but also lower refunds — and, for some, an unexpected bill.
